properties.title: Hammetschwand Lift Bürgenstock
properties.abstract: Laid between 1900 and 1905, the Rock-face Path is a traditional, some might say, mythical mountain trail. Together with the spectacular Hammetschwand Lift, it propels the visitor to the highest point of the city of Lucerne.
properties.description: The panoramic Hammetschwand Lift is for those with a sense of adventure and a head for heights. It offers imposing views of the rock-face falling steeply away towards the lake. Europe’s tallest free-standing outdoor lift, it whisks its passengers in a little less than a minute to the awe-inspiring viewing terrace atop Mt. Bürgenstock. The 152.8 metre-tall lift represents one of the boldest construction feats of the "Belle Epoque”.
properties.name: Nidwalden Tourismus
